messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the JAX-RS (RESTEasy) with Netty as HTTP transport framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/KeyspaceOpsResources.java`, I found that `KeyspaceOpsResources.create` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/api/v0/ops/keyspace/create`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
- Full HTTP request path
  /api/v0/ops/keyspace/create

- All HTTP methods acceptable
  false

- HEAD
  false

- POST
  true

- OPTIONS
  false

- TRACE
  false

- GET
  false

- PUT
  false

- DELETE
  false

- PATCH
  false

Explanation:
- The resource class is annotated with @Path("/api/v0/ops/keyspace") and the create method is annotated with @Path("/create"), so the full path is the concatenation: /api/v0/ops/keyspace/create.
- The create method is annotated with @POST and no other JAX-RS HTTP method annotations (@GET, @PUT, @DELETE, @HEAD, @OPTIONS, @PATCH, etc.) are present. Per the code, only POST is explicitly supported, so POST = true and all other methods = false.
- There is no wildcard or catch‑all HTTP-method handler (no custom @HttpMethod or similar), so “all methods acceptable” is false.
